intro: Olea hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish olive, is a species of flowering plant in the Oleaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit, the olive, is a drupe that ripens to a dark purple color. Olea hispanica is native to the Iberian Peninsula and is well adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates.
